page.title: 01AYR, STRATHCLYDE, SCOTLAND.
page.content: { Ayr}is a medium sized town at the mouth of the River Ayr on the South West coast of Scotland. The population is about 47000. The mild climate makes it ideal for{holiday}makers who} have a choice of dozens of hotels and} guest houses. There are{golf}courses all over Ayr and not far away are the world famous Prestwick Old, Royal Troon and Turnberry courses . There are numerous bowling greens and excellent tennis facilities. In the town are three wooded parks with flower gardens and fourteen miles away is{Culzean Castle and Country Park. The Scottish poet {Robert Burns}was born near Ayr and the town is the hub of the Burns Heritage Trail. For hundreds of years, since 1205, Ayr has been the county market town and is a busy shopping centre. A lot of people retire to Ayr.
